revised_title: Structural Analysis of High Density Lipoprotein (HDL3) in Porcine Plasma
tldr: The authors studied the structure of a high density lipoprotein (HDL3) from porcine plasma using small-angle X-ray scattering techniques. They found that HDL3 has a particle of radius of gyration 5.5 nm, with a central low electron density (lipid) core and an outer electron dense polar annulus. This research helps to understand the organization and interactions of lipid and protein constituents in lipoproteins.
